title: Bug 49299 - Custom cookie name not affecting URL rewriting
description: Bug 49299 - Chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf states that a custom name for session tracking cookies should also be used as the name of the URI parameter if URL rewriting is enabled. However, the actual behavior is different. The cookie is set correctly, but the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid' instead of the custom cookie name. The provided attachment 'cookiename.war' demonstrates the issue.
OB:
When accessing the page, the following cookie is sent:
SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly
However, the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid':
http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4
EB:
Expected result: When the custom cookie name is configured, the Reload link should use the custom cookie name instead of 'jsessionid'. The correct URL format should be:
http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Deploy the provided 'cookiename.war' file to a servlet container.
2. Access the page using a web browser.
3. Observe the cookie sent in the request header.
4. Click on the Reload link on the page and observe the URL format.
